intro: Carex arenaria var. posnaniensis, commonly known as the Posnan sand sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. This variety thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or dune environments. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to withstand harsh, wind-blown conditions. It plays an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity.
